messages.message: Zendesk: Zen and the art of Reliability (https://zendesk.engineering/zen-and-the-art-of-reliability-f42fa7e64849). The 8 principles are in the :thread: .

1. Measure true customer impact: we can’t improve what we don’t measure and customers don’t care who runs the service, they care that they can’t use Zendesk
2. Focus efforts on core features: we can’t make everything equally reliable at the same time
3. Assume failure & simulate failure: computers fail, mistakes are made, get good at it
4. Fail small, reducing blast radius: failure isn’t all bad, we need to make sure we have strategies to reduce impact when it occurs
5. Protect our infrastructure from misuse & slowly ramp up capacity: systems need clear boundaries to be built reliably
6. Automate most things and have it self-heal: humans can’t be alerted, assemble, diagnose and mitigate within 20 minutes
7. Improve our customer communications: transparent and timely communication builds trust
8. Ramp up our reliability goals over time: unachievable goals don’t motivate people
